summary: An email chain from Mark Epstein to an FBI agent, inquiring about the reopened investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. Mark Epstein expresses frustration over not knowing basic details, such as the position of the body when found, and asks to question the guard who discovered it. He also seeks clarification on who at the FBI is leading the death investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death in prison
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his prison cell. The email references the investigation into the circumstances that allowed this to happen and the FBI's investigation into the death itself.

events.title: Reopened investigation into Epstein's death
events.description: Mark Epstein references being told a few months prior that the DOJ had reopened the investigation about Jeffrey Epstein's death, though he later clarifies it is about the prison circumstances.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein states the DOJ told him they had reopened the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death, but he was later informed it was specifically about the circumstances in the prison that allowed it to happen.
The FBI is stated to be in charge of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death itself.
Mark Epstein expresses frustration that, two and a half years after the death, he does not know basic details like the position of Jeffrey Epstein's body when first found.
Mark Epstein specifically asks to question the guard (referred to as 'Ryas', though this appears to be a typo or fragment) who first discovered Jeffrey Epstein's body.
The email seeks to identify who at the FBI is in charge of the death investigation.
